result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis O. Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $200+ costs = $805. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term.
The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis O. Collins

No updated address information - unable to forward.  (07/26) ML
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (07/26) ML

[Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]
[ma] Case called at 2:00 PM   {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
Defendant Curtis O. Collins appears.Attorney Osman A Mirza appears.   DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #1

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $200+ costs = $805. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term.

The Court requires the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
recess: 2:15pm
Letter to the Court re Zoom
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 9:01am 
Defendant Curtis O. Collins does not appear. Attorney Osman A Mirza appears by Zoom videoconference. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mirza indicates that he has no explanation for the non-appearance, however he asks that the Court excuse the non-appearance and schedule a plea and sentencing hearing. 
The Court authorizes the issuance of a Warrant but stays the Warrant to the next hearing date.  If Attorney Mirza files an Authorization, then the Warrant Authorization is vacated. 
recess 9:03am.

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on July 5th at 2:00pm--JA note in comments that a warrant has been authorized but stayed to this date
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] cases #22CM3, #22CM4 called at 9:00am 
Co-Defendant Curtis O. Collins in court. His counsel, Attorney Osman A Mirza, appears by telephone.
Co-Defendant Jasmane L. Cavazos Garcia appears with Attorney Karl Huebner.
ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
As to #22CM3: Attorney Mirza indicates that discovery has been received; he proposes the scheduling of another status conference. 
As to #22CM4: Attorney Huebner indicates there is an offer in place which Ms. Cavazos Garcia is not accepting. He proposes setting the case for trial if the Co-Defendant is ready for such scheduling. 
recess 9:03am

NEXT:  Status Conference on June 10th at 9:00am

Att Osman Mirza
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:21pm 
Defendant Curtis O. Collins appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.

The Court requires a $500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1
--no discussion of the case with Co-Defendant, Witness 1, or Witness 2

recess 1:25  pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/2/22 at 2:40pm   (2) Status Conference on 4/7/22 at 9:00am
